item.title: Stocks Post Gains, but Bond Market Signals Investors Are Anxious
item.description: The slumping dollar and increase in yields on U.S. government bonds were signs that the world’s faith in the United States economy had been shaken.

item.title: For Taiwan’s Small Exporters, the Uncertainty’s as Bad as the Tariffs
item.description: The island’s many small factories have thrived by being frugal — and flexible. But President Trump’s unpredictability is testing their limits.

item.title: What to Know About U.S. Talks With Iran Over Its Nuclear Program
item.description: The two sides are set to negotiate on Saturday, though expectations for a breakthrough are modest, and distrust high.

item.title: Boeing Helped Power Russia’s Economy. Could It Return?
item.description: Moscow is hinting that the company would be welcome back as part of a thaw under President Trump. Industry skepticism runs deep.

item.title: Brice Oligui Nguema Is Favored to Win Gabon Election
item.description: A military officer who seized power but promised to step down is expected to win the presidential vote on Saturday.
